Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro:
When you bring attention to good behaviours, your teen is likely to behave well more often and feel good about themselves!

Here are 4ï¸âƒ£ simple tips for praising Your Teen:
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ *SEE IT*

ğŸ‘€ Look for anything good or helpful that Your Teen does.

â¸ Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ *SAY IT*

ğŸ† Praise them when you see them do something you like.

âœ… Tell them specifically what they have done well.

ğŸ‰ Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

ğŸ”„ This way, they are more likely to do it again.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ *REPEAT IT*

ğŸŒ· Look for something to praise Your Teen for every day.

ğŸ”¶ Even if it is something really small, keep doing it.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ *KEEP IT POSITIVE*

ğŸ’¡ Make sure you focus on something Your Teen has done well.

ğŸ™‚You can show your praise with a big smile and words. You can also give Your Teen a thumbs-up, hug, or high-five to show you appreciate them.

ğŸŒˆ Keeping it positive reminds your teen that you notice them and care.

To continue building a positive relationship with Your Teen, letâ€™s make one-on-one time a part of a routine. You can use the tips in this lesson to create other daily routines with Your Teen. 

Creating other daily routines with Your Teen will help them feel more calm and connected with you and behave better.  ğŸ”‘ Help them plan time for resting, meals, chores, school, and sleep. â°

1ï¸âƒ£ BE A TEAM

2ï¸âƒ£ BE CONSISTENT

ğŸ‘€ Make sure Your Teen follows their routines daily.

ğŸ’™ This helps your teen feel secure, calm and connected to you because they know what to expect.

ğŸŒ± Feeling secure means Your Teen has space to grow, develop and gain independence.

3ï¸âƒ£ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE

ğŸˆ Praise Your Teen for creating a routine with you.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: Here are 6ï¸âƒ£ tips for how you can help Your Teen learn how to cope with their emotions: LEARN, NOTICE, OPEN, TALK, SHARE and CARE
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ LEARN

ğŸ’¡ Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions that each send us a very specific message:

ğŸ˜ƒHappy: Keep doing things that make you feel good.

ğŸ˜”Sad: Something important in your life needs attention.

ğŸ”´Angry: Stand up for ourselves and set limits.

ğŸ˜£Disgusted: Move away from what we don't like.

ğŸ‘€Surprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.

ğŸš©Afraid: Run away from danger.

ğŸ¨ As teens, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ NOTICE

ğŸ‘€ Begin observing these 6 emotions in yourself and in Your Teen.

ğŸ˜ƒğŸ˜’ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜£ Notice how each emotion feels in your body.
 
ğŸ˜ƒ You can also notice positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness.

ğŸ’™ Noticing can also help your teen to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ OPEN

Be open, notice ğŸ‘€, and listen ğŸ‘‚ to Your Teen when they share how they are feeling. 
ğŸ’› Accept how you and Your Teen feel. Remember, your body and their body are sending messages about what you both are feeling, and those messages are important.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ TALK

ğŸ˜’ It is normal to struggle to talk about and express emotions and feelings. 

ğŸ“ Remember, it is also normal to experience feelings in different ways.

â­ When Your Teen is feeling an emotion, describe what you are observing in a calm way. 
For example, 

â€œI notice you slammed the door, talk loudly, and your face looks a bit upset. Are you feeling angry because you canâ€™t go out at night?â€

You can also help Your Teen manage different emotions by encouraging them to share how they feel and supporting them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.5.text:
5ï¸âƒ£ SHARE

ğŸ˜ƒ Share your own feelings with Your Teen. 

For example, â€œI would feel the same way if I couldnâ€™t go out when I wanted toâ€. 

 ğŸˆThis sets a good example and shows Your Teen that it's okay to share their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.6.text:
6ï¸âƒ£ CARE

ğŸŒ· Use actions and words to make Your Teen feel accepted and loved. 

â­ Do some active exercise to shake out anger, give each other some space, or take some deep breaths to calm down. These are some ways to deal with your emotions. 

ğŸ’š Remind Your Teen that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.module_name: Keeping Calm When We Are Stressed
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about how we can keep calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our teens. ğŸ’š
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list:
As you began noticing feelings, you may have noticed feelings of anger, frustration or sadness. 

ğŸŒ· We love our teens, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life! 

ğŸ’¡ It is important for us to stay in control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: When I am angry at my teen, I should show that I am angry so that they stop misbehaving.

ğŸ‰ Thatâ€™s correct! 

ğŸ’› It can be very difficult when your teen is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything. 

ğŸŒ± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
ğŸ‘€ Oops! Thatâ€™s not actually true.

ğŸ’› It can be very difficult when your teen is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything. 

ğŸŒ± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: There are 4ï¸âƒ£ steps to keeping calm in stressful situations: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ *BE CALM*

âœ… Be aware of your own feelings.

âœ…Take a pause or a few breaths before asking Your Teen to do something else.

âœ… Speak with Your Teen in a calm voice.

âœ… Remember your goal: Help Your Teen feel loved and connected to you.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ *BE QUICK*

â° There are other things you can do to help manage unwanted behaviour before it becomes stressful. 

âœ¨ Praise something positive that your teen did today. 

âœ¨ Understand their feelings. For example, it may feel boring to clean up after having fun or ending a big task. 

âœ¨ When you see Your Teen is about to start unwanted behaviour, distract them by asking them to do something else, before the unwanted behaviour begins or gets worse. 

âœ¨ Invite Your Teen in a chore you are doing. You can ask Your Teen to think of a fun and quick way of doing the chores differently. 

ğŸ’¡ Preventing unwanted behaviour is much easier than disciplining them after they have done something wrong!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ *BE CLEAR*

âœ… Rather than saying what you DONâ€™T want, tell Your Teen what you DO want them to do.

For example, say:

âœ¨ â€œPlease speak more softly.â€ instead of â€œStop shouting!â€

âœ¨ â€œRemember to hang your jacket in your cupboard, please.â€ 
instead of â€œDonâ€™t leave your jacket on the floor!â€

This way, it is easier for them to follow! â­
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4ï¸âƒ£ *BE POSITIVE*

âœ… Praise Your Teen when they behave well!

âœ… Invite Your Teen to a positive activity when you see they are about to start an unwanted behaviour.

âœ… It will also help them know what you expect from them!

Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro: In a dangerous situation, we might freeze â„ï¸ or get angry ğŸ˜¡ â€“ thatâ€™s normal. These tools can help keep you and your teen safe: KNOW IT, SEE IT, SAY IT
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **KNOW IT**

Know the difference between healthy and unhealthy relationships â¤ï¸âŒ. If you're attacked, itâ€™s never your fault. Do what you need to stay safe and get away â€”don't worry about what others think. You are worth defending ğŸ’ª. You are strong and powerful âš¡.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ **SEE IT**

If someone makes you or anyone else feel uncomfortable with what they say or do, itâ€™s never okay! We all have the right to feel safe, especially at home ğŸ . Trust your gut. If you feel attacked by words or actions, your goal is to get away.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ **SAY IT**

Your voice can stop many attacks.  

Be clear, confident, and direct. Use your voice, body language, and eye contact. If you don't feel safe, you can do whatever it takes to get away.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.4.text:
Using your voice can look different in different situations. You could shout "No!", call for help, act strangely to confuse the attacker, or negotiate.
Here are some things you might say or shout to avoid a tough situation:
â€œI will call the police if you touch me again ğŸš”.â€
â€œDo not touch my bum!â€ ğŸ‘
Or you might say:
â€œNo lift for me, thanks! Last time I got a lift, I threw up!â€ ğŸ¤®
â€œI will give you my phone if you let me go.â€ ğŸ“±
Think about what you would do in some of the examples we have looked at. There is no wrong answer! âœ¨
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.5.text: Remember, if someone hurts you, itâ€™s never your fault. Ask someone you trust for help ğŸ¤. Make sure your teen knows they can tell you anything so you can find a solution together.

Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro: Here are some things you can do to support your teen when they share something difficult with you:
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ **BREATHE**: Take a pause

2ï¸âƒ£ **LISTEN**: Ask Your Teen what is going on

â— Tell Your Teen not to click on pop-ups that ask them to download or pay for anything.

Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about taking care of yourself. ğŸŒ±
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is a simple stretching and movement activity that may help you with stress:
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. 
...
Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. 
...
Stretch to both sides. 
...
Stretch to the front and to the back.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
Let your hands hang by your side. 
...
Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. 
...
Release your shoulders as you relax your body.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take four deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
...
Relax your arms and let them swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.4.text: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from the ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.5.text: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.6.text:
Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out. 
...
Raise and lower your arms, breathing in and out, 4 more times.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.7.text:
Take a moment to reflect on your experience. 
...
Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Mental Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this course, we are learning about the changes teens go through as they grow up. Today, we will learn about changes happening to your teenâ€™s mind.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: When you understand how Your Teen is changing, you can provide them with the support they might need and keep them safe.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Letâ€™s see how much you know about the changes your teen may be experiencing as they grow older!
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: Which is common for teens?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: More Confidence|Less risk-taking|Struggling with identity and self-image|More trusting of people in charge
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct! Teens are trying to figure out who they are and what they want to be, which can be confusing and make them doubt themselves.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: ğŸ‘€ Oops! Good Try! Teens often struggle with identity and self-image as they figure out who they are and what they want to be.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: How can parents help their teens cope with mood swings during adolescence?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: Ignore their feelings|Punish them for their emotions|Let them know their feelings are okay and be there for them|Encourage them to ignore their emotions
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: Let them know their feelings are okay and be there for them
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: You are right! Parents can help by listening to their teens, noticing their feelings, and being there for them.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Parents can help by letting their teen know their feelings are okay and being there for them.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: Why is it important to have healthy communication with your teen during adolescence?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: It's not important. Teens need to figure things out on their own|It helps build trust and strengthens relationships|It keeps my teen from keeping secrets
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: It helps build trust and strengthens relationships
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct! Communication between parents and teens is important because it helps them understand and trust each other more.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Communication between parents and teens is important because it helps them understand and trust each other more.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teenâ€™s developing mind and how to talk with them about it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ THE DEVELOPING MIND

ğŸŒ± Your Teenâ€™s brain hasnâ€™t changed this fast since they were a baby. 

ğŸš© Teens sometimes behave in risky ways as they test what is possible and allowed, especially if it is exciting or fun. 

â— Teens donâ€™t have the ability to always think ahead about how their behaviours might impact themselves or other people.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ BECOMING MORE INDEPENDENT

â­ Teens are on their way to becoming adults.

ğŸŒˆ They are becoming better at sharing their ideas and are thinking more about long-term goals and their future.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ HOW TO SUPPORT YOUR TEEN

To support your teen:

ğŸ”‘ Guide their choices by balancing rules and limits with independence. 

ğŸ… You can give them more freedom to make their own choices when they show they can be responsible and take responsibility for their actions.

âœ¨ Be supportive, loving, and positive with your teen. This helps them feel more calm and connected with you, and they're more likely to come to you for help or advice when they need it.

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Social Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this lesson we are continuing to learn about the changes your teen may be experiencing as they get older. Today we are exploring social changes.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: When you understand how Your Teen is growing and changing, you can help them when they face difficulties in social situations.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Letâ€™s see how much you know about the social changes Your Teen may be experiencing:
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: Which of the following is a common social change that teens experience?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: They become less interested in spending time with friends.|They become less influenced by peer pressure.|They may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.answer: They may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct. Teens may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: ğŸ‘€ Oops! Good Try! Teens may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: How can parents help their teens handle social changes?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: By always choosing their friends for them|By encouraging them to make their own decisions and supporting them through the consequences|By avoiding discussions about social issues
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: By encouraging them to make their own decisions and supporting them through the consequences
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: Correct. Parents can encourage their teen to make their own decisions and be there for them through consequences.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Parents can encourage their teen to make their own decisions and be there for them through consequences.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: What impact can bullying have on a teen?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: Improved self-esteem|A sense of belonging|Low self-esteem and avoiding interaction with others
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: Low self-esteem and avoiding interaction with others
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct. Bullying can make teens feel bad about themselves and become less social.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Bullying can make teens feel bad about themselves and become less social.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teenâ€™s social life and how to talk with them about it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ THE SOCIAL LIVES OF TEENS

âš½ Having friends is very important to Your Teen because it helps them learn how to be a good friend and understand other people's feelings better. This is a big part of growing up and becoming an adult.

ğŸ‘€ Your teen may want to feel like they belong with their peers and do things others think are cool. They might talk or dress like others while figuring out who they are. 

ğŸ˜” Sometimes, when teens have a hard time making friends, they might be bullied by other kids.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ HOW TO SUPPORT YOUR TEEN

ğŸ¨ Let Your Teen try different clothing and hairstyles and spend time with different people. Show them you accept them, just as they are. 

â° Tell Your Teen what you expect of them, but give them the freedom to make safe choices at home or outside, such as how to spend their free time.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ THE FACTS

Here are some facts to share with Your Child:

ğŸ’™ Good friends look out for you, care about you, include you in activities, and treat you with respect. 

ğŸš© A bully is someone who keeps trying to hurt others, either by making them feel bad or using their strength to be mean. 

ğŸŒˆ To stop bullying in school, it's important to be kind and respectful to others. This makes everyone feel happy and safe at school.

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Physical Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this lesson, we continue to learn about the changes your teen may experience as they get older. Today, we are exploring their physical changes. These changes are part of the phase of reaching sexual maturity called puberty.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: Talking openly with Your Teen about the changes they are experiencing in their body can help them reduce their stress around these changes and care for themselves
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Hereâ€™s a quick quiz to see how much you know about puberty!
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: What is puberty, and when does it often begin for girls?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: A time when the body goes through physical and hormonal changes. It often begins between ages 8 and 13 for girls|A time when the mind becomes more mature. It often begins between ages 16 and 18 for girls|A time when the body stops growing. It often begins around age 25 for girls
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.answer: A time when the body goes through physical and hormonal changes. It often begins between ages 8 and 13 for girls
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct! Puberty is when a person's body undergoes changes as they grow into adults. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: ğŸ‘€ Oops! Good Try! Puberty is when a person's body goes through changes as they grow into an adult. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: What are some common physical changes that occur during puberty for girls?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: Increased height, deeper voice, and wider shoulders|Growth of breasts, pubic and underarm hair, and menstruation|Less hunger, longer sleep patterns, and more energy levels
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: Growth of breasts, pubic and underarm hair, and menstruation
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: Correct! During puberty, girls undergo many physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. During puberty, girls go through a lot of physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: How can parents support their daughters during puberty?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: By talking openly about puberty and offering reassurance and support|By ignoring the changes and allowing their daughter to figure it out on her own|By discouraging their daughter from asking questions and seeking help if needed
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: By talking openly about puberty and offering reassurance and support
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct! Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their daughters feel comfortable and confident. This can make girls feel better about growing up.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their daughters feel comfortable and confident. This can make girls feel better about growing up.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teenâ€™s developing body and how to talk with them about it:
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1ï¸âƒ£ TALK

ğŸŒ± Help Your Teen understand it is normal to go through physical changes during puberty.

âœ… Tell Your Teen that these changes happen to everyone and that they are not alone.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2ï¸âƒ£ LEARN

â­ Provide Your Teen with accurate information about puberty, sex, and the changes they are experiencing. This will help them make good decisions to stay healthy and safe.

ğŸ’› Encourage them to ask questions and seek help if they need it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3ï¸âƒ£ SUPPORT

ğŸš Encourage Your Teen to develop healthy habits like eating a balanced diet, getting enough sleep, and exercising regularly.

âš½ Help them find activities they enjoy doing to feel confident and strong in their body.ğŸ’™Help Your Teen think about the consequences of their behaviours without shame or blame. Guide them on where they can find information to inform their decisions.
